perturbation.original_text: To make generally available to securityholders of the Company as soon as practicable, but in any event not later than eighteen months after the effective date of the Registration Statement (as defined in Rule 158(c) under the Act), an earnings statement of the Company and its subsidiaries (which need not be audited) complying with Section 11(a) of the Act and the rules and regulations thereunder (including, at the option of the Company, Rule 158);
perturbation.changed_text: To make generally available to securityholders of the Company as soon as practicable, but in any event not later than thirty months after the effective date of the Registration Statement (as defined in Rule 158(c) under the Act), an earnings statement of the Company and its subsidiaries (which need not be audited) complying with Section 11(a) of the Act and the rules and regulations thereunder (including, at the option of the Company, Rule 158);
perturbation.explanation: Extended timeline for providing earnings statement to security holders.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Section 11(a) of the Securities Act of 1933 and Rule 158(c)
perturbation.law_explanation: Rule 158(c) under the Securities Act specifies that the earnings statement must be made available within 18 months after the effective date of the registration statement to comply with Section 11(a) of the Act. By changing the timeline to 'thirty months', the modified text contradicts this established regulatory deadline.

perturbation.changed_text: All statements, requests, notices and agreements hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given if mailed or transmitted by any standard form of telecommunication; notices to the Remarketing Agents shall be directed to Deutsche Bank Securities Inc., 60 Wall Street, New York, NY 10005; notices to the Company shall be delivered or sent by mail to the address of the Company set forth in the Registration Statement, Attention: General Counsel; notices to the Trustee shall be delivered or sent by mail to The Bank of New York Mellon Trust Company, N.A., 2 North LaSalle Street, Suite 1020, Chicago, Illinois 60602; notices to the Stock Purchase Contract Agent shall be delivered or sent by mail to Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, Trust and Securities Services, 60 Wall Street, 16th Floor, MS: NYC60-2710, New York, NY 10005; and notices to the Collateral Agent or the Custodial Agent shall be delivered or sent by mail to Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, Trust and Securities Services, 60 Wall Street, 16th Floor, MS: NYC60-2710, New York, NY 10005. Any such statements, requests, notices or agreements shall take effect five business days after the time of sending thereof.
perturbation.explanation: By removing expedited forms of communications and delaying effective date, the parties' obligations might be delayed and not be able to comply with the timing requirement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act
perturbation.law_explanation: The modification removes the option for electronic transmission of notices and changes the effective time to five business days after sending. This could potentially conflict with 15 U.S. Code § 7001, which generally validates electronic signatures and records, especially if other provisions in the agreement rely on prompt notification for time-sensitive actions. The five-day delay in effectiveness may also be deemed unreasonable in certain commercial contexts, undermining the intent of the law to facilitate electronic commerce.

perturbation.original_text: A Remarketing Agent may resign and be discharged from its duties and obligations hereunder, and the Company may remove any or all of the Remarketing Agents, by giving five (5) Business Days' prior written notice to the Stock Purchase Contract Agent and, in the case of a removal, to the Remarketing Agents; provided that no such resignation nor any removal of all the Remarketing Agents shall become effective until the Company shall have appointed at least one nationally recognized broker-dealer as successor to the Remarketing Agents, and such successor Remarketing Agent shall have entered into a letter substantially in the form of Annex III hereof with the Company and the Stock Purchase Contract Agent in which it shall have agreed to conduct the Remarketing in accordance with the Remarketing Procedures.
perturbation.changed_text: A Remarketing Agent may resign and be discharged from its duties and obligations hereunder, and the Company may remove any or all of the Remarketing Agents, by giving one (1) Business Day' prior written notice to the Stock Purchase Contract Agent and, in the case of a removal, to the Remarketing Agents; provided that no such resignation nor any removal of all the Remarketing Agents shall become effective until the Company shall have appointed at least one nationally recognized broker-dealer as successor to the Remarketing Agents, and such successor Remarketing Agent shall have entered into a letter substantially in the form of Annex III hereof with the Company and the Stock Purchase Contract Agent in which it shall have agreed to conduct the Remarketing in accordance with the Remarketing Procedures.
perturbation.explanation: Reduced notice for remarketing agent resignation or removal.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing
perturbation.law_explanation: New York law (NY UCC § 1-304) imposes an implied duty of good faith and fair dealing in the performance and enforcement of every contract. Reducing the notice period for resignation or removal of a Remarketing Agent to just one business day could be argued as a breach of this duty, particularly if it hinders the orderly transition of responsibilities and negatively impacts the remarketing process. A one-day notice might not provide sufficient time to appoint a suitable replacement, potentially jeopardizing the interests of the Company and the security holders.
